wikipedia_page.main: Wing Commander Vashon James "PK" Wheeler,  (16 September 1898 – 23 March 1944) was a British Army and Royal Air Force officer who served as an infantry officer in both the First World War and the North Russia intervention, and then as a fighter and bomber pilot in the Second World War.

response: *Vashon James Wheeler (1898–1944), British airman during World War II

link_mentions.page: RAF Bomber Command aircrew of World War II
response: Wing Commander Vashon James Wheeler, MC and Bar, DFC and Bar, Order of St. Stanislaus commanding No. 207 Squadron RAF was aged 46 when he was killed in action on 23 March 1944 flying an Avro Lancaster;Rolfe (2003), p.74 he was a veteran pilot who had served in World War I and had half of a hand shot off.War Graves Commission – W/Cdr. V. J. Wheeler MC* DFC* casualty details
